course_mapping: Course MATH 005A (Single Variable Calculus I) at Pasadena City College must be taken to satisfy course MATH 1A (Calculus) at University of California, Berkeley for the computer science major.

Course MATH 005B (Single Variable Calculus II) and MATH 055 (Differential Equations) at Pasadena City College must be taken to satisfy course MATH 1B (Calculus) at University of California, Berkeley for the computer science major.

Course MATH 010 (Linear Algebra and Applications) and MATH 055 (Differential Equations) at Pasadena City College must be taken to satisfy course MATH 54 (Linear Algebra and Differential Equations) at University of California, Berkeley for the computer science major.

Course CS 031 (Introduction to Data Science) at Pasadena City College must be taken to satisfy course DATA C8 (Foundations of Data Science) at University of California, Berkeley for the computer science major.

Course CS 008 (Fundamentals of Computer Science III - Data Structures) or CS 003B (Fundamentals of Computer Science (JAVA)) and CS 033 (Advanced JAVA Programming and Algorithm with Data Structures) or CS 003C (Fundamentals of Computer Science (Python)) and CS 034 (Advanced Python Programming and Basic Data Structures) at Pasadena City College must be taken to satisfy course COMPSCI 61B (Data Structures) at University of California, Berkeley for the computer science major.
